destinations.distanceFromHelsinki: Approx. 80 km south across the Gulf of Finland
highlights: Tallinn Old Town (UNESCO World Heritage Site)
Toompea Castle and Alexander Nevsky Cathedral

directFerry.portInHelsinki: South Harbor (Olympia Terminal) or Katajanokka Terminal
directFerry.frequency: 1-2 daily departures (Tallink Silja Line and Viking Line)

directFlight.frequency: Multiple flights daily (8-10 on most days) by Finnair, SAS, and Norwegian

destinations.distanceFromHelsinki: Approx. 400 km west across the Baltic Sea

destinations.whyGo: Finland's oldest city and former capital with a rich maritime heritage, featuring a medieval castle, historic cathedral, charming riverfront, and gateway to the beautiful Finnish Archipelago with its thousands of islands.

Picturesque medieval town just east of Helsinki, known for its well-preserved colorful wooden houses along the river, cobblestone streets, historic Old Town, artisan shops, and charming cafés serving traditional Finnish pastries.

Finland's third-largest city located between two large lakes, featuring industrial heritage, numerous museums, vibrant cultural scene, bustling food markets, and beautiful nature areas within the city limits.
highlights: Särkänniemi Amusement Park and Observation Tower

destinations.whyGo: Denmark's vibrant capital, famous for Tivoli Gardens, colorful Nyhavn harbor, world-class design, pioneering Nordic cuisine, cycling culture, and a perfect blend of historic charm and modern innovation.

directFlight.frequency: Multiple flights daily (5-7 on most days) by Finnair, SAS, and Norwegian

destinations.whyGo: Latvia's capital and the largest city in the Baltic states, known for its extensive Art Nouveau architecture, medieval Old Town (UNESCO World Heritage site), vibrant Central Market, and dynamic cultural scene.

directFlight.frequency: Multiple flights daily (3-4 on most days) by Finnair and airBaltic

combinedTransport.option1: Ferry to Tallinn (2 hours) then bus to Riga (4.5 hours)
combinedTransport.option2: Ferry to Tallinn (2 hours) then train to Riga (starting late 2023/2024)

destinations.whyGo: Capital of Finnish Lapland and the official hometown of Santa Claus, offering northern lights viewing, reindeer farm visits, husky sledding, and Arctic adventures in a pristine winter wonderland.

directFlight.frequency: Multiple flights daily (5-6 on most days) by Finnair and Norwegian

directTrain.frequency: 1-2 daily departures including night trains (VR Finnish Railways)

highlights: Santa Claus Village and Arctic Circle

destinations.whyGo: Lithuania's capital with one of the largest medieval old towns in Europe (UNESCO World Heritage site), featuring baroque architecture, historic churches, bohemian districts, and a rich Jewish heritage.

directFlight.frequency: Daily flights by Finnair (2-3 on most days)

combinedTransport.option1: Ferry to Tallinn (2 hours) then bus to Vilnius (9 hours)
combinedTransport.option2: Ferry to Tallinn (2 hours) then train via Riga (starting late 2023/2024)

highlights: Museum of Occupations and Freedom Fights
